question.text: All the following statements are correct, except

options.text: Interphase is the shortest period of cell cycle
Cell growth, in terms of cytoplasmic increase, is a continuous process
Cycles of growth and division allow a single cell to form a structure consisting of millions of cell
The replicated DNA are distributed to daughter nuclei by a complex series of events during cell division.

solution.text: Interphase is the phase of the cell cycle in which the cell spends and performs the majority of its time. Then, in preparation for cellular division, it increases in size. Mitosis (nuclear division) is the most dramatic stage of the cell cycle, involving a major reorganisation of virtually all components of the cell. During mitosis (Nuclear Division) the chromosome condense, the nuclear envelope of most cells break down, the cytoskeleton reorganise to form the mitotic spindle and the chromosome move to opposite pole.
